text: hi guys I'm Laura Vitale on this episode
of Laura in the kitchen I'm going to
show you how to make tres leches cake
it's a classic Mexican cake or Spanish
cake it's a cake drenched in a mixture
of three different milk products it's
delicious it's been highly requested for
so so long so I thought hey Cinco DeMayo
is around the corner so it's the perfect
time to show you this recipe let me take
you already ingredients so we can get
started you need some cake flour baking
powder salt regular sugar egg yolks egg
whites unsalted butter at room
temperature whole milk and vanilla
extract those are your ingredients to
make the base the actual cake part and
then a little bit I'll show you the
remaining ingredients and the first
thing you wanna do is that you have been
preheated to 350 second thing you wanna
do is take a 9 by 13 inch baking dish or
baking pan line it with parchment paper
and just spread it a little bit with
nonstick spray just to ensure nothing's
gonna stick now I know that there are
plenty variations of this recipe and I
think it's fantastic this is just the
way I make it and this recipe was given
to me by a friend of mine who actually
is from Mexico I've only changed two
things about the recipe really I've
changed using cake flour instead of
regular all-purpose flour because when
you drench the cake in the milk mixture
I mean it makes it heavy it makes a dent
which is delicious but I want it to
somehow keep it a little bit a little
bit lighter and by switching to cake
flour I really feel like I've gotten
that texture that I want and also I beat
the egg whites and egg yolks separately
just to get more like fluffiness and
light and moistness into the cake itself
so let's get started in this bowl here

unsalted butter at room temperature
super-important and my sugar and I'm

about one minute
after this is an ad in my trying to

four minutes or until he comes nice
thick and pale and in the meantime good
in the meantime I'm going to shoot with
my handheld whisk here I'm going to beat
my egg whites until they become nice
frothy and if they develop stiff peaks
but don't over beat them my egg whites
are just how I want them so I'm going to
set this aside check on my butter
looking great my egg yolks and butter
they've gotten really nice thick and

perfect my batter is exactly I want it
make sure you get it off the beater if

and now I'm going to add in my egg

this cake batter
amazing so now I'm just going to pour

then you just want to make sure you
level this out so that everything is

if you want to use regular flour
